title: Asia's richest man gets $1.5 billion from Saudi Arabia for his tech war chest
description: In less than two months, Indian billionaire Mukesh Ambani has amassed more than $15 billion in investments to fuel his technology ambitions from the likes of Facebook and top Silicon Valley investors Silver Lake and TPG.

title: Putin rewrites World War II history -- and does battle over historical memory
description: William Faulkner's famous line, "the past is never dead. It's not even past," is back in vogue. It's not just about debate in the US about removing Confederate statues, or in the UK over monuments to imperialists -- the war over World War II is back in play, too.

title: Too much sitting raises risk for cancer, study finds
description: Too much sitting can raise the risk for cancer, but you can overcome it with movement, a new study finds. Replacing at least 30 minutes of sitting with either light, moderate or vigorous physical activity can lower that risk.

title: Blindspots and turncoats: How Trump's mostly white casting has backfired
description: Even the nation's most powerful casting director sometimes gets it wrong.

title: Florida has the makings of the next Covid-19 epicenter, experts say
JFK's last surviving sibling, Jean Kennedy Smith, dies at 92
description: Jean Kennedy Smith, a former diplomat and the last surviving sibling of President John F. Kennedy, died Wednesday in her New York apartment, her daughter, Kym Smith, told CNN. She was 92.

title: John Roberts defies Trump and conservatives with another legacy decision
Why a gun shop owner banned masks for walk-in customers
description: Florida gun shop owner Alex Shkop, talks to CNN's Brianna Keilar about why he's choosing to ban masks for walk-in customers from his store amid a pandemic.

title: Facebook takes down Trump ads for using symbol that looks like one used by Nazis
description: Facebook on Thursday said it had take action against ads run by President Trump's re-election campaign for breaching its policies on hate. The ads, which attacked what the Trump campaign described as "Dangerous MOBS of far-left groups," featured an upside-down triangle.

title: The country where it feels like Covid-19 never happened
description: The bars and restaurants are full. People are out enjoying themselves. Spectacular geological attractions are wide open to tourists. Anyone visiting Iceland right now could be forgiven for thinking they've arrived in a parallel universe where the coronovirus never happened.

title: British forces' 'sweetheart' and singer Vera Lynn has died
description: Dame Vera Lynn, whose sentimental ballads during World War II provided the soundtrack for the Allied war effort, has died at the age of 103, according to a statement from the Dame Vera Lynn Children's Charity.

title: Hear UK foreign secretary's 'Game of Thrones' comment on 'taking the knee'
description: Britain's Foreign Secretary, Dominic Raab said he has "full respect" for the Black Lives Matter movement, after saying that the gesture of "taking the knee" felt more like a symbol of subjugation than liberation.

title: Ex-Atlanta officers involved in Rayshard Brooks killing turn themselves in
Canadian politician kicked out of parliament after calling opponent 'racist'
description: The leader of Canada's New Democratic Party, Jagmeet Singh, was made to leave parliament on Wednesday after calling another politician "racist."

title: Transatlantic trade fight looms as US blows up talks on taxing big tech
Evidence of huge carnivorous dinosaurs discovered in Australia
description: Scientists have found evidence that large carnivorous dinosaurs lived in Australia.

title: White man rescued by Black Lives Matter protester is former police officer
description: A white man who was carried to safety by a Black Lives Matter protester after he was allegedly attacked amid violent clashes is a former police officer, British Transport Police confirmed.

title: Half-brother of man found hanged dies in a deputy-involved shooting
description: The half-brother of Robert Fuller, the 24-year-old black man who was found dead hanging in the city of Palmdale, California, last week, was killed in a deputy-involved shooting in Kern County on Wednesday, according to Fuller's family attorney.

title: Scientists have grown mini brains containing Neanderthal DNA
description: A  team of researchers has grown blobs of brain tissue from human stem cells that contain Neanderthal DNA. The hope is that this research will shed more light on how Neanderthals relate to modern humans.

title: This Bahamas sculpture garden is underwater
description: There are 700 islands in the Bahamas, 2,000 beaches, 32 national parks -- and one underwater art installation.

title: Siberia is having 'alarming' prolonged warm weather
description: Siberia's prolonged period of unusually warm weather is an "alarming sign," according to climate change scientists.

title: Kristen Stewart set to play Princess Diana
description: Kristen Stewart is set to play Princess Diana in an upcoming movie that will focus on the late princess' split from Prince Charles.

title: Reality star admits to $2,500-a-day meth habit
description: Things got really bad for Mama June Shannon, the reality star admitted.

title: NYC diner's drive-in becomes hot ticket during coronavirus
description: One New York City diner is turning their parking lot into a venue for drive-in movies and stand up comedy shows during the coronavirus pandemic. CNN's Bill Weir reports.

title: See what Tulsa's Black Wall Street has become
description: 99 years ago, Black Wall Street in Tulsa's Greenwood neighborhood was burned down in a historic race riot. CNN's Abby Phillip visits the site and talks to descendants of survivors of the attack.

title: India may be about to ramp up an alliance Beijing can't stand
Top black player welcomes 'massive step' after players take a knee before Premier League restart
description: Manchester City forward Raheem Sterling says players taking a knee before the Premier League restart was a "massive step" in the fight against racism.

title: Player slams 'disgusting discrimination' as US Open omits wheelchair tennis
description: Australian Dylan Alcott has slammed US Open organizers for their "disgusting discrimination" in choosing to omit wheelchair tennis from this year's tournament.

title: Ford's electric Mustang will offer hands-free driving technology next year
description: Owners of Ford's Mustang Mach-E electric SUV will be able to add hands-free highway driving technology to their vehicles late next year.

title: The boy from town 'where dreams seem unreachable' who became a global superstar
description: Laguna Larga is an unassuming Argentine town of no more than 6,000 inhabitants.

title: India may be about to ramp up an alliance Beijing can't stand
description: • Analysis: China's military edge over India may no longer exist

title: Qantas cancels international flights until October. New Zealand may be the exception
description: Australian flagship carrier Qantas has canceled most of its international flights for the next four months on the expectation that the coronavirus pandemic will last through most of the year.

title: Trump reacts to bombshells from John Bolton's new book
description: During an interview on Fox News, President Donald Trump reacted to the stunning accusations in former national security adviser John Bolton's new book, calling Bolton a "washed-up guy."

title: How China and India came to bloodiest clash in decades
description: More details are emerging about the bloodiest clash in decades between India and China in the disputed border in the Himalayas. Satellite images taken by Planet Labs, Inc. show structures in the Galwan Valley-area, which Indians say, led to the skirmish. CNN's Sam Kiley reports.

title: Players and referees all take a knee before first Premier League match
description: With the eyes of the world on the English Premier League's long-awaited resumption, players and staff of the two clubs -- Aston Villa and Sheffield United -- as well as the refereeing officials all took a knee before the first game of the interrupted season kicked off.

title: Conventional wisdom giving China the military edge over India may not be true
description: India and China went to war in 1962 over the same Himalayan region where at least 20 soldiers were killed Monday night in a bloody confrontation between the two sides.

title: Here's how some US cities and states are honoring Juneteenth
John Bolton betrayed his country
description: John Bolton has offered the nation a staggering profile in cowardice. He has left no doubt about his own monumental betrayal of his country.

title: Ex-officer who shot Rayshard Brooks charged with murder
description: • LIVE: Officer kicked Brooks after shooting him, DA says

title: The encounter, according to ex-adviser, happened in June 2019 with Trump 'pleading with Xi to ensure he'd win'
description: Former national security adviser John Bolton claims in his new book that the House impeachment inquiry should have investigated President Donald Trump for potentially dubious actions beyond those related to Ukraine, according to the New York Times, which obtained a copy of the book in advance of its scheduled publication.

title: I moved to Asia, got cancer, and then coronavirus happened
description: I moved to Hong Kong on the day of a huge protest marking China's National Day on October 1 and thought it would probably be the wildest experience I'd have all year. Two months later, during Hanukkah, I found out that I had breast cancer. So, while the global coronavirus crisis was the most challenging thing that happened to nearly everyone else on the planet in 2020, it barely made my top five.

title: Beauty of mastectomy tattoos revealed in powerful photo project
description: In the portrait series "Reclaim" women in diffuse pink lighting reveal delicately tattooed designs inked across their chests, unfurling over scar tissue in explosions of color or in black and gray. Nude, with nothing else in the frame, the women embody a sense of openness.

title: One woman's 350-mile trek home to escape Covid-19
Former Missouri police officer charged after hitting man with his car
description: A fired police officer in suburban St. Louis was charged with assault, a day after video was released showing his unmarked SUV striking a man and the officer getting out of the vehicle and kicking him, a prosecutor said.

title: Trump asked China's Xi to help him win 2020 election, Bolton claims in excerpt of new book
Ex-officer who shot Rayshard Brooks charged with murder
'They're in denial': How Trump's White House is ignoring the pandemic
Spotify strikes exclusive podcasting deal with Kim Kardashian West
description: Editor's Note: Spotify is featured in an upcoming "Risk Takers" TV special. It airs on CNN on Saturday, June 20 at 2:30 pm ET.

title: Actor Danny Masterson arrested on rape charges in Los Angeles
description: Actor Danny Masterson, best known for his role on "That '70s Show," was charged with three counts of rape, Los Angeles County District Attorney Jackie Lacey announced Wednesday.
